content: dragon s egg hat this hat is the perfect gauge swatch for our here be dragons jumper pattern it is big enough that you can make an accurate measurement of both stitch and row gauge over the pattern and have something more interesting than a square to show for it dragon s egg is a fitted beanie style available in four sizes it is knitted flat from the brim up and sewn together to maintain the pattern correctly across the seam the sample hats were made in west yorkshire spinners re treat chunky and re treat twist chunky which are 100% wool roving style yarns the hats were washed and allowed to dry unstretched to retain the texture of the stitch pattern if making as a gauge swatch for the matching jumper we recommend making the medium or large size to give enough stitches for an accurate measurement wash and dry the hat then take the gauge measurement before sewing it up the pattern is fully charted sizes extra small small child brim circumference 38cm height crown to brim 15cm small older child/teen brim circumference 42cm height crown to brim 18cm medium adult brim circumference 44cm height crown to brim 20cm large large adult brim circumference = 50cm height crown to brim 24cm if you prefer a slouchy fit or have a lot of hair to tuck under your hat consider going up a size materials yarn wys re treat chunky 100% wool 140m per 100g ball one ball per hat approximate yarn requirement xs s m l 45m 60m 75m 100m needles 5 5mm for ribbed brim and 6 0mm for body of hat in twisted stitch pattern gauge stocking stitch 15 5 stitches x 20 row to 10cm using 6mm needles note that re treat chunky gives the stocking stitch gauge on the ball band as 14 stitches x 19 row using 6 5mm needles twisted stitch pattern 16 stitches x 24 row 2 pattern repeats wide and tall should be 10cm wide x 10 75cm tall using 6mm needles abbreviations k = knit p = purl rs = right side ws = wrong side st s = stitches k2tog = knit 2 together ssk = slip slip knit = slip 1 st knitwise slip another st knitwise return both sts to left hand needle and knit together through back loops lt = left twist = knit second stitch on lefthand needle through back of loop leave it on the needle knit first stitch on lefthand needle through front of loop and take both stitches off lefthand needle rt = right twist = knit second stitch on lefthand needle through front of loop leave it on the needle
